name: system.cpu.frequency
help: Current frequency of the CPU core in Hz.

name: system.cpu.logical.count
help: Number of available logical CPUs.

name: system.cpu.physical.count
help: Number of available physical CPUs.

name: system.cpu.time
help: Total seconds each logical CPU spent on each mode.

name: system.cpu.utilization
help: Difference in system.cpu.time since the last measurement per logical CPU, divided by the elapsed time (value in interval [0,1]).

name: system.disk.io
help: Disk bytes transferred.

name: system.disk.io_time
help: Time disk spent activated. On Windows, this is calculated as the inverse of disk idle time.

name: system.disk.merged
help: The number of disk reads/writes merged into single physical disk access operations.

name: system.disk.operation_time
help: Time spent in disk operations.

name: system.disk.operations
help: Disk operations count.

name: system.disk.pending_operations
help: The queue size of pending I/O operations.

name: system.disk.weighted_io_time
help: Time disk spent activated multiplied by the queue length.

name: system.filesystem.inodes.usage
help: FileSystem inodes used.

name: system.filesystem.usage
help: Filesystem bytes used.

name: system.filesystem.utilization
help: Fraction of filesystem bytes used.

name: system.cpu.load_average.15m
help: Average CPU Load over 15 minutes.

name: system.cpu.load_average.1m
help: Average CPU Load over 1 minute.

name: system.cpu.load_average.5m
help: Average CPU Load over 5 minutes.

name: system.linux.memory.available
help: An estimate of how much memory is available for starting new applications, without swapping. This is a more accurate alternative than system.memory.usage with state=free. (Linux only)

name: system.linux.memory.dirty
help: The amount of dirty memory according to `/proc/meminfo`.

name: system.memory.limit
help: Total bytes of memory available.

name: system.memory.page_size
help: A constant value for the system's configured page size.

name: system.memory.usage
help: Bytes of memory in use.

name: system.memory.utilization
help: Percentage of memory bytes in use.

name: system.network.connections
help: The number of connections.

name: system.network.conntrack.count
help: The count of entries in conntrack table.

name: system.network.conntrack.max
help: The limit for entries in the conntrack table.

name: system.network.dropped
help: The number of packets dropped.

name: system.network.errors
help: The number of errors encountered.

name: system.network.io
help: The number of bytes transmitted and received.

name: system.network.packets
help: The number of packets transferred.

name: nfs.client.net.count
help: Reports the count of kernel NFS client TCP segments and UDP datagrams handled.

name: nfs.client.net.tcp.connection.accepted
help: Reports the count of kernel NFS client TCP connections accepted

name: nfs.client.operation.count
help: Reports the count of kernel NFSv4+ client operations

name: nfs.client.procedure.count
help: Reports the count of kernel NFS client procedures

name: nfs.client.rpc.authrefresh.count
help: Reports the count of kernel NFS client RPC authentication refreshes

name: nfs.client.rpc.count
help: Reports the count of kernel NFS client RPCs sent, regardless of whether they're accepted/rejected by the server.

name: nfs.client.rpc.retransmit.count
help: Reports the count of kernel NFS client RPC retransmits

name: nfs.server.fh.stale.count
help: Reports the cumulative count of kernel NFS server stale file handles.

name: nfs.server.io
help: Reports the count of kernel NFS server bytes returned to receive and transmit (read and write) requests.

name: nfs.server.net.count
help: Reports the count of kernel NFS server TCP segments and UDP datagrams handled.

name: nfs.server.net.tcp.connection.accepted
help: Reports the count of kernel NFS server TCP connections accepted

name: nfs.server.operation.count
help: Reports the count of kernel NFSv4+ server operations

name: nfs.server.procedure.count
help: Reports the count of kernel NFS server procedures

name: nfs.server.repcache.requests
help: Reports the kernel NFS server reply cache request count by cache hit status.

name: nfs.server.rpc.count
help: Reports the count of kernel NFS server RPCs handled.

name: nfs.server.thread.count
help: Reports the count of kernel NFS server available threads

name: system.paging.faults
help: The number of page faults.

name: system.paging.operations
help: The number of paging operations.

name: system.paging.usage
help: Swap (unix) or pagefile (windows) usage.

name: system.paging.utilization
help: Swap (unix) or pagefile (windows) utilization.

name: system.processes.count
help: Total number of processes in each state.

name: system.processes.created
help: Total number of created processes.

name: process.context_switches
help: Number of times the process has been context switched.

name: process.cpu.time
help: Total CPU seconds broken down by different states.

name: process.cpu.utilization
help: Percentage of total CPU time used by the process since last scrape, expressed as a value between 0 and 1. On the first scrape, no data point is emitted for this metric.

name: process.disk.io
help: Disk bytes transferred.

name: process.disk.operations
help: Number of disk operations performed by the process.

name: process.handles
help: Number of open handles held by the process.

name: process.memory.usage
help: The amount of physical memory in use.

name: process.memory.utilization
help: Percentage of total physical memory that is used by the process.

name: process.memory.virtual
help: Virtual memory size.

name: process.open_file_descriptors
help: Number of file descriptors in use by the process.

name: process.paging.faults
help: Number of page faults the process has made.

name: process.signals_pending
help: Number of pending signals for the process.

name: process.threads
help: Process threads count.

name: process.uptime
help: The time the process has been running.

name: system.uptime
help: The time the system has been running
